headline: Heard on the Street Recap: The Fed’s in a Tight Spot
summary: Suspense is building in the market ahead of the Federal Reserve's interest-rate announcement coming Wednesday afternoon.  Retail sales rose 0.6% in August, which was higher than the 0.3% rise economists had predicted.  Stronger retail sales may complicate the case for numerous interest rate cuts if central bankers believe inflation is still a risk.

Stronger retail sales may complicate the case for numerous interest rate cuts if central bankers believe inflation is still a risk.

headline: Tesla settles two lawsuits on 2019 California crashes related to Autopilot software
summary: Tesla has reached confidential deals to resolve two lawsuits over deaths in two separate California crashes in 2019 involving the company's Autopilot advanced-driver-assistance software, according to court documents.  The settlements come weeks after a Florida jury ordered Tesla to pay $243 million in compensatory and punitive damages to the victims of another fatal 2019 crash of a Model S that was equipped with Autopilot.  Tesla hired a trio of prominent new lawyers and asked a judge to find the verdict legally unjustified and throw out the case, or to order a new trial.

raw.headline: Tesla settles two lawsuits on 2019 California crashes related to Autopilot software
raw.summary: Tesla has reached confidential deals to resolve two lawsuits over deaths in two separate California crashes in 2019 involving the company's Autopilot advanced-driver-assistance software, according to court documents.  The settlements come weeks after a Florida jury ordered Tesla to pay $243 million in compensatory and punitive damages to the victims of another fatal 2019 crash of a Model S that was equipped with Autopilot.  Tesla hired a trio of prominent new lawyers and asked a judge to find the verdict legally unjustified and throw out the case, or to order a new trial.

headline: Energy Transition Today - Statkraft Sells Indian Assets To Serentica For Strategic Focus
summary: Statkraft, Europe’s largest producer of renewable energy, has entered into an agreement to sell part of its renewable energy portfolio in India to Serentica Renewables. This transaction involves a 1.5 GWp capacity in Rajasthan, consisting of an operational solar plant and a variety of solar and wind projects in different developmental stages. The move aligns with Statkraft's strategy to focus investments on core markets in Europe and South America, reinforcing their commitment to the global...
